intro: Angelica sylvestris var. villosa, commonly known as hairy angelica, is a biennial or perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features large, deeply lobed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it its common name. The plant produces tall, slender stems with clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its root system is thick and fleshy, often used in traditional medicine for its aromatic and medicinal properties. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
